ygData.subject: Re: Armor Prices
ygData.msgSnippet: You or another member of your guild could also start your own smith.  If all of you supported your smith by buying supplies for him I think he would advance
ygData.messageBody:
You or another member of your guild could also start your own smith. If
all of you supported your smith by buying supplies for him I think he
would advance quickly to where you need him. Then when they are good
they can make you all armor for free to pay you back but also can sell
to players outside your guild for fair prices.

Unless of course APEC (armor producing enriched characters) doesn't put
your new smith under their spell and concince him to sell at their
inflated prices... hehe

-----Original Message-----
From: Rodney Miller [mailto:RMiller@...]
Sent: Thursday, May 06, 1999 8:04 AM
To: 'eqpaladin@onelist.com'
Subject: Re: [eqpaladin] Armor Prices


From: Rodney Miller <RMiller@...>

Dear Fellow Paladins:

I am presently on the Innoruuk server and spend most of my time near
Freeport and the surrounding zones. My question to you all is, what are
you
paying for armor? All the blacksmiths in my area have formed some kind
of
price guild and all charge basically the same price for banded armor. I
realize this is supposed to be free enterprise and let the people set
the
prices but we are getting price fixing on my server. I had a friend on
another server tell me not to pay more than 25 plat for a Banded Tunic,
but
the cheapest any of the blacksmiths (I have checked with 3 different
smiths
at different times of the day) will sell the tunic for on the Innoruuk
server is 35 plat. What do all of you pay? I have tried to negotiate
with
each blacksmith, offering my pledge of allegiance to him, but to no
avail. I
have just been a part of forming a guild so I am thinking about having
my
guild only deal with one smith if we can find one who will give us a
break.


What are your experiences in this area? Are any of you on the Innoruuk
server? I am going to try and go to some different areas like
Butcherblock
and such to see if I can find any less expensive blacksmiths. Now,
before
some blacksmiths email me and tell me how hard it is to get up your
level in
smithing, and how much it costs, I know. I understand. I just don't
like
price fixing. I would rather negotiate and barter with each guy
independently, rather than get a set price with no negotiation.

Please give me your feedback.

Grod
Paladin of the 14th Level (soon to be 15th)
Innoruuk Server
